overview_of_class: This course builds on the fundamentals developed in Chemistry 212-1 and 212-2. It will include pericyclic reactions, functional group participation, rearrangements, fragmentations, radical reactions, synthesis and reactions of carbenes and nitrenes, the synthesis and chemistry of synthetic polymers, and the bioorganic chemistry of carbohydrates, nucleosides, nucleotides, nucleic acids, amino acids, peptides, and lipids.
name: Organic Chemistry
title: WCAS CHEM 212-3-01 Organic Chemistry

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course builds on the fundamentals developed in Chemistry 212-1 and 212-2. It will include pericyclic reactions, functional group participation, rearrangements, fragmentations, radical reactions, synthesis and reactions of carbenes and nitrenes, the synthesis and chemistry of synthetic polymers, and the bioorganic chemistry of carbohydrates, nucleosides, nucleotides, nucleic acids, amino acids, peptides, and lipids.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
Prerequisite: Student must earn a grade of C- or better in Chemistry 212-2 and Chemistry 232-2.

AP credit does not allow registration for Chemistry 212-3. Students must complete the other courses in the sequence first.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Organic Chemistry, Clayden, Greeves, and Warren, 2nd Edition, Oxford Univ. Press. ($189.95 new; $142.45 used)***

***Prices as listed at Northwestern Norris Bookstore on 2/3/17. Materials may be available from other vendors at lower prices.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value:
Solutions Manual to Accompany Organic Chemistry by Clayden et al. 2nd Edition ($54.95 new; $41.20 used)***
Molecular Model Kit ($41.15 new; $30.85 used)***

***Prices as listed at Northwestern Norris Bookstore on 2/3/17. Materials may be available from other vendors at lower prices.

subject: CHEM
